reporting-org.narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre

title.narrative: Food security project in (10) Yemeni governorates

description.narrative: Enabling food-insecure families in the most needy and conflict-affected areas and displaced families to obtain food assistance Filling and alleviating the need by 51% in the targeted districts and providing a decent life for the Yemeni citizen without being exposed to the risk of hunger, and increasing the impact of the aid provided by the center by targeting families at a rate of 6 distribution sessions per family.

Providing (93,438) food baskets for needy families who are classified in the fourth stage of the Integrated Interim Classification (IPC) in six stages, so that (15,573) food baskets are distributed in each stage. Securing (4,922) food baskets in emergency cases during the project period.

Providing food security for families classified in phase (4) of the Integrated Phase Classification (IPC) for (122,970) beneficiaries in 10 Yemeni governorates. Alleviating food insecurity and closing the necessity gap by 51% in 23 districts for approximately (93,438) individuals during the project period. Rapid response in emergency situations for approximately (29,532) individuals. Achieving food security for (122,970) beneficiaries in (23) districts.

participating-org.narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre
